Others: India opened their Super Eights account with an excellent 47-run over Afghanistan in Barbados on Thursday.
Suryakumar Yadav's second successive half-century of the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 came at a strike rate of almost 190.
India's middle order got much-needed time, with every batter from three to eight scoring at a decent strike rate.
Jasprit Bumrah took 3/7 to stunt any chance Afghanistan had of closing in on the target.
Rashid Khan remained reliably world-class, giving India's top batters Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant early dismissals.
